prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing congratulations greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

ðŸŽ¨ CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clichÃ© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Fun energetic colorful "
Style: ðŸŽ­ Pop Art
Tone: ðŸ¤ª Quirky - unique and unconventional
To: Teresa 
From: John older brother 
Message: "Teresa,
Heard your big news surprised retirement. I can't believe you beat me to retirement and it looks like youâ€™ve officially collected enough awesome work points to level up in life! Your world is about to get even more freedom to make a more colorful Life and I can't wait to see the masterpiece you create. So proud of you, sis!
To tell you the truth, I'm just jealous of your new freedom

- Your brother, John"

Reference: "Use a person with the curly hair and glasses as the main person to celebrate. Make everyone else happy cartoon figures. The background is a Italian bakery shop"

CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front â†’ interior â†’ back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the unique and unconventional tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way






- Create cartoon/illustrated characters inspired by reference image - DO NOT make realistic depictions

Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "congratulations" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). TEXT STYLE: Write the greeting text in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that matches the elegant style used inside the card - legible, flowing, and graceful with natural character and warmth. I have included my own reference image. Create a stylized cartoon/illustrated character inspired by the reference image - DO NOT make realistic depictions of real people, instead create charming cartoon-style characters with simplified, friendly features. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in pop art style like Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein, with bold colors, comic book elements, halftone dots, and graphic design aesthetics

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a congratulations card with unique and unconventional tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in pop art style like Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein, with bold colors, comic book elements, halftone dots, and graphic design aesthetics

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "Teresa,
Heard your big news surprised retirement. I can't believe you beat me to retirement and it looks like youâ€™ve officially collected enough awesome work points to level up in life! Your world is about to get even more freedom to make a more colorful Life and I can't wait to see the masterpiece you create. So proud of you, sis!
To tell you the truth, I'm just jealous of your new freedom

- Your brother, John" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. HANDWRITING STYLE: Write the message in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal. The handwriting should be legible, flowing, and have natural character - not overly perfect but graceful and warm. Use a nice pen-style appearance with natural ink flow and slight variations in line weight. Think of sophisticated calligraphy that's still approachable and easy to read. Make the handwriting feel genuine and heartfelt. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the handwritten message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clichÃ© designs and create something genuinely special! Use the elegant cursive handwriting style described above. Style: in pop art style like Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein, with bold colors, comic book elements, halftone dots, and graphic design aesthetics

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. IMPORTANT: Leave the bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) completely clear and undecorated - this space is reserved for a QR code. Focus decorative elements toward the center and left side of the design. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in pop art style like Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein, with bold colors, comic book elements, halftone dots, and graphic design aesthetics

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover: Front cover of a greeting card, in a vibrant Pop Art style reminiscent of Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein, featuring bold outlines, flat colors, and halftone dot patterns. The central figure, a jubilant cartoon woman with curly dark hair, glasses, a yellow polka-dot top, and a red skirt, is leaping joyfully in mid-air. She holds a purple briefcase in her left hand and a large artist's paintbrush in her right, with energetic yellow and blue rays radiating from behind her. Below her, a group of diverse, happy cartoon figures are gathered. Two figures on the left are holding a box of donuts, and to their right is a man in a blue shirt. A woman with curly hair and sunglasses, mirroring the style of the main figure but with different clothing, stands next to a smiling older woman with white curly hair. The background depicts an Italian bakery setting, with displays of donuts and pastries visible, a clock on the wall, and a sign reading "ESPRESSO CAPPUCCINO." The greeting "Congratulations" is presented in a white speech bubble with a thick black outline, positioned centrally. The overall color palette is bright and energetic, dominated by yellows, blues, reds, and pinks. The mood is overwhelmingly joyful, celebratory, and quirky. The artwork is flat, 2D, and full-bleed.
generatedPrompts.backCover: Back cover design for a greeting card with a Pop Art style. The background is a vibrant, solid hot pink. Scattered across the entire background are numerous small, oval-shaped sprinkles in bright colors: yellow, red, and blue, each with a thick black outline. The composition is clean and focused, with a clear visual space in the bottom right corner intentionally left blank for a QR code. The overall aesthetic is cheerful and minimalistic, evoking a sense of playful celebration with a very simple, yet impactful visual. The colors and sprinkle motif tie back to a celebratory, sweet theme, providing a lighthearted conclusion.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a congratulations greeting card with a bold Pop Art style, inspired by Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein. The background is a vibrant, energetic yellow, filled with small, subtle teal halftone dots. Dominating the center is a stylized comic book explosion or "POW!" graphic, rendered in a creamy off-white speech bubble with sharp, angular points. Inside this bubble, the word "POW!" is emblazoned in a thick, impactful sans-serif font, colored in a bright, primary red with a black outline. Emerging from the bottom of the "POW!" and swirling upwards are dynamic, ribbon-like forms in contrasting bright blue, hot pink, and a warm orange. These forms are rendered with a textured, almost painterly quality, suggesting movement and energy. Around the central "POW!" graphic, sharp, starburst shapes in red and blue radiate outwards, also outlined in black, further emphasizing the explosive, energetic theme. The overall composition is dense with color and movement, creating a visually striking and memorable design. There is no text present on this specific interior page as per the prompt's instructions to focus on the artwork for the left side. The artistic elements are consistent with the Pop Art aesthetic, featuring bold colors, graphic shapes, and a high-contrast feel. The creative choice here is the abstract, swirling forms within the iconic "POW!" graphic, making it unique and energetic without being clichÃ©. The color palette is bright and cheerful, fitting the "fun energetic colorful" theme.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with a bright teal background. Dominating the left side of the page is a large, curved, stylized yellow shape reminiscent of a palette or a large, abstract brush stroke, filled with various colorful circular elements. These circles contain bold patterns: one with scattered small red dots, another with larger red dots, one with a turquoise chevron pattern, one with pink and white diagonal stripes, and a bottom one with a blue zigzag lightning bolt pattern. The entire design is rendered in a bold Pop Art style, inspired by Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein, featuring flat colors, strong black outlines, and graphic design aesthetics. The message text, "Teresa, Heard your big news surprised retirement. I can't believe you beat me to retirement and it looks like youâ€™ve officially collected enough awesome work points to level up in Life! Your world is about to get even more freedom to make a more colorful Life and I can't wait to see the masterpiece you create. So proud of you, sis! To tell you the truth, I'm just jealous of your new freedom - Your brother, John", is elegantly handwritten in a flowing, dark cursive script across the right two-thirds of the card, with ample spacing around the text to ensure legibility and a clean presentation against the vibrant background. The script is warm, personal, and easy to read, with natural ink flow and slight variations in line weight, fitting within the safe printing margins. The overall composition is energetic, colorful, and unique, fulfilling the quirky and fun theme.
